summary: This document is an email chain between defense attorney Bobbi C. Sternheim and federal prosecutors regarding scheduling the trial date for United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell. Sternheim argues for a November 8, 2021 trial date, citing Maxwell's extended detention's negative impact on her health, and suggests greater date flexibility if Maxwell is released pending trial.

persons.name: Bobbi C. Sternheim
persons.context: Attorney representing Ghislaine Maxwell, corresponding with prosecutors to schedule a trial date and advocating for a November 8, 2021 date due to concerns about Maxwell's health in detention.

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: Federal prosecutor copied on the email correspondence regarding the scheduling of Ghislaine Maxwell's trial.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Defense attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell copied on the email correspondence regarding trial scheduling.

persons.name: Jeff Pagliuca
persons.context: Defense attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell copied on the email correspondence regarding trial scheduling.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The accused in the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell. Her defense team cites her extended detention's deleterious effect on her health and well-being as a reason for an earlier trial date.

connections.description: Sternheim is the lead defense attorney representing Maxwell, advocating for her trial scheduling preferences and potential release.
Sternheim (defense) and Everdell (prosecution) are corresponding as opposing counsel in the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell.
Both are listed as defense attorneys for Ghislaine Maxwell on the same email correspondence.
Both are listed as defense attorneys for Ghislaine Maxwell on the same email correspondence.

events.title: Proposed Trial Date
events.description: The defense's earliest and preferred date for the trial of Ghislaine Maxwell, as stated in their correspondence.

events.title: Defense Letter-Motion Filed
events.description: The defense filed a letter-motion (Docket 246) detailing their position, which is referenced in the scheduling emails.

locations: Law Offices of Bobbi C. Sternheim (West 19th Street office, noted as closed due to Covid-19)
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team, led by Bobbi C. Sternheim, was actively pushing for a November 8, 2021 trial date.
The defense argued that Maxwell's extended period of detention was having a 'deleterious effect on her health and well-being.'
The defense indicated they would have greater flexibility on the trial date if Maxwell was released pending trial.
The email chain shows coordination between Maxwell's defense attorneys (Sternheim, Menninger, Pagliuca) and federal prosecutors (including Everdell) regarding trial scheduling.
The correspondence references a prior defense filing (a letter-motion dated April 22, 2021, Docket 246) that detailed their position.
